channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overflowing bins outside 13-15, 27th November
item.description:
Persistent waste including dirty nappies overflowing onto the street and posing a health and safety hazard for residents
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Gunton Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two street lights not working, 27th November
item.description:
Street light outside no 1 and no 12 are not working / 2no columns so street v dark. Pls treat as urgent
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ferrings, Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: West side of Tennyson Road at junction with Glengall Road, 27th November
item.description:
A previous request for removing slippery leaves on this busy thoroughfare has not removed the hazard. A man came with a blower on 26th or 27th November but this was of no use since there are piles of mouldy wet leaves stuck to the pavement. He did not pick up a single leaf so they are still there. I just spent an hour sweeping some of it up. Not acceptable with the amount of council tax we pay. Your system should not be saying a job is complete when not a single leaf has been collected.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Tennyson Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti on building and seating area, 27th November
item.description:

item.title: End of the Bluebell Close, 27th November

Fly tipping. Issue now for over 6 years with continuous items being dumped. L&Q Housing state itâ€™s not their problem as the area belongs to Number 9

item.title: Old Maidstone Road Illegal camping public nuisance, 27th November
item.description:
German camper been parked in Street for 2 weeks.. People living in it.. Foul water dropping over road.. straight out the bottom of the van.. You tell me where the toilet waste is going!! in the hedge.. Or chucked down a storm drain.. got to be vans now going anywhere nowhere else for it to go..

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Old Maidstone Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Continued littering, 27th November
item.description:
